justification: The protection of biodiversity can reinforce the quality of food by preserving ecosystem services that support agriculture, such as pollination and pest control.
The conservation of biodiversity might constrain food affordability by limiting the availability of certain food products or increasing their costs.
The restoration of agricultural ecosystems is inextricably linked to competitive agriculture, as it aims to improve the productivity and sustainability of agricultural practices.
The restoration of forests might counteract the reduction of pesticides, as some forest management practices might require the use of pesticides.
The restoration of marine ecosystems can enable the production of healthy food by supporting the health of marine species and ecosystems that are used as food sources.
The protection of biodiversity in fisheries might constrain food affordability by limiting the availability of certain fish products or increasing their costs.
The protection of urban nature can reinforce food quality by preserving ecosystem services that support urban agriculture, such as pollination and pest control.
The restoration of terrestrial ecosystems might counteract the reduction of pesticides, as some ecosystem restoration practices might require the use of pesticides.
The monitoring of biodiversity might constrain food quality by limiting the availability of certain food products or increasing their costs.
The restoration of rivers can enable food affordability by supporting the health of aquatic ecosystems that are used as food sources.
The restoration of agricultural ecosystems can reinforce social security for workers by improving their working conditions and promoting sustainable agriculture practices.
